sectiondef.header: Maximum dump bytes in an event string
Dump in an event scratch string size

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Support function for MM_PeekCmd. This routine will read 8, 16, or 32 bits of data and send it in an event message.

parameterdescription.para: A #MM_PeekCmd_t pointer to the peek command message
The source address for the peek operation

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Support function for MM_DumpMemToFileCmd. This routine will read an address range and store the data in a file.

parameterdescription.para: The open file handle of the dump file
A pointer to a character string holding the dump file name
A #MM_LoadDumpFileHeader_t pointer to the dump file header structure initialized with data based upon the command message parameters

entry.para: Returns TRUE if the dump completed successfully
Returns FALSE if the dump failed due to an error

briefdescription.para: Verify memory dump to file parameters.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine will run various checks on the source address, memory type, and data size (in bytes) for a dump memory to file command.

parameterdescription.para: The source address for the requested dump operation
The source memory type for the requested dump operation
The number of bytes for the requested dump operation

entry.para: Returns TRUE if all the parameter checks passed
Returns FALSE any parameter check failed

briefdescription.para: Write the cFE primary and and MM secondary file headers.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Support function for MM_DumpMemToFileCmd. This routine will write the cFE primary and MM secondary headers to the file specified by the FileHandle.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a character string holding the file name (used only for error event messages).
File Descriptor obtained from a previous call to OS_open that is associated with the file whose headers are to be written.
A CFE_FS_Header_t pointer to the cFE primary file header structure to be written.
A #MM_LoadDumpFileHeader_t pointer to the MM secondary file header structure to be written.

entry.para: Returns TRUE if the headers were written successfully
Returns FALSE if a write error occurred

briefdescription.para: Verify memory dump in event message parameters.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine will run various checks on the source address, memory type, and data size (in bytes) for a dump memory in event message command.

parameterdescription.para: The source address for the requested dump operation
The source memory type for the requested dump operation
The number of bytes for the requested dump operation

entry.para: Returns TRUE if all the parameter checks passed
Returns FALSE any parameter check failed

briefdescription.para: Fill dump memory in event message buffer.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Support function for MM_DumpInEventCmd. This routine will read an address range and store the data in a byte array. It will properly adjust for optional memory types that may require 16 or 32 bit reads.

parameterdescription.para: The source address to read from
A #MM_DumpInEventCmd_t pointer to the dump in event command message
A pointer to the byte array to store the dump data in
A pointer to the byte array holding the dump data

entry.para: Returns TRUE if all PSP memory access functions succeed
Returns FALSE if any PSP memory access function fails

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Processes the memory peek command that will read a memory location and report the data in an event message.

parameterdescription.para: A CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references the software bus message

briefdescription.para: Process memory dump to file command.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Processes the memory dump to file command that will read a address range of memory and store the data in a command specified file.

parameterdescription.para: A CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references the software bus message

briefdescription.para: Process memory dump in event command.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Processes the memory dump in event command that will read up to MM_MAX_DUMP_INEVENT_BYTES from memory and report the data in an event message.

parameterdescription.para: A CFE_SB_MsgPtr_t pointer that references the software bus message
